page.title: 04THE VILLAGE OF WELLINGHAM
page.content: The small village of Wellingham lies to the east of the A1065 just north of Weasenham.It has a population of 26 adults and 10 children.Six of the adults are over 60 years old.Eight of the total population are Norfolk people.The church is dedicated to St Andrew.Very few services are held there now.There is one telephone box and one letter box and no shop.The public house"The Old Plough"is now closed and the chapel is converted into a dwelling.There are two farmhouses,ten homes and six holiday/weekend cottages. The children attend Weasenham school till 11 years old and then go to Litcham High school.Some children attend private schools.Private cars are used as school taxis. Public transport does not serve this village.
